“[P]ig starts farm fire by excreting pedometer …
The North Yorkshire fire and rescue service said the fire was caused by ‘nature taking its course’
and copper from the pedometer battery reacting with dry hay and the pigpen’s contents.
The pedometer was being used to prove the animal was free range
and had been taken off one of its fellow pigs.
No animals were harmed as a result of the fire.”
The fire was caused when nature took its course:
Although the beast met no impediment
It proved that ranging freely may be trouble

brought to the brink of doom by plastic straws.

Then Starbucks bravely rallied to our cause!
“Three cheers!” I say and raise a grateful venti.
If we can just hold on till 2020.”

I’ve started carving off my ears;

“’We were just sitting out in the middle of the ocean and then this huge male seal appeared with an octopus and he was thrashing him about for ages
column2: ’ Mulinder told the news channel. ‘I was like ‘mate
column3: what just happened?’ It was weird because it happened so fast but I could feel all the hard parts of the octopus on my face.’”—The Guardian

column1: He liked to sit with sea all round and call the creatures “mate”;
Until the day eight tentacles unfurled across his face.
His face was full of octopus—he had no time to dodge;
It did not act with animus
That octopodic incubus that flipped him in the face.
A mollusk-flinging seal had caught Mulinder off his guard:
He had not known an octopus had parts so very hard.
He scratched his newly-slimy head. “What happened
And wincing at the syllable the whiskered one replied:
“Your face is full of octopus; here’s why I had you sluiced:
I see no need to flap and flail; I think I’ve made my case;
Don’t make me find a killer whale to flip you in the face.”
—an email ad by Dr. Gil Mobley

and Silent But Deadly will not be a joke!

With all these new accomplishments I’m learning
His eager mind will be profusely fed.

He’ll rate the art of Tin Tin and of Titian

The plan’s complete: I’m ready to adopt him—

All that we know is the words he expressed to us
Prayers for a future serene and illustrious;
May we be granted a way to be happier;
May there be deities wishing us well!
What did the Sun Goddess say to the Emperor?
a boss with brains like pot cheese

column1: In trawler and in shallop we’ve pursued the precious scallop
Chief ingredient of our Coquille St. Jacques;
But if you make your mission messin’ with our humble fishin’
You limey bastards better watch your backs!
We shun those who are selfish when it comes to nettin’ shellfish
When we’re limited to fishing by the book;
Those Brits who hate this ban’ll simply sail across the Channel
But we won’t float there helplessly and look.
We’re pissed off—with good reason—for you ruthlessly can seize on
Technicalities that let you grab our stocks
We’ll just see how well you get on

From the nation that invented fish and chips.

I did not intentionally fail to remember.

column1: She did let the poet inside me prevail
And saved me from marrying Emily Hale.
I was not in love with Miss Hale in the least:
That what I had taken for love was
A memory only of love in my youth;
And it was impossible not to divine
She did not respect my beliefs on divorce.
My love was the love of a ghost for a ghost;
We never had sex. May we all rest in peace.
